title: Spring Morning
provenance_text:
John Henry Twachtman [1853-1902], Greenwich, CT, until August 1902; John Henry Twachtman estate and Mrs. John Henry Twachtman (Martha Scudder Twachtman) [1858-1935], Greenwich, CT, August 1902 until at least December 1910 [1]; William T. Evans [1843-1918], New York, NY and Montclair, NJ, by February 1911 until April 1, 1913 [2]; Evans sale, American Art Association, Plaza Hotel, New York, NY, March 31, April 1, and April 2, 1913, lot no. 125 [3]; Macbeth Galleries, New York, NY, April 1913 [4]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, April 1913 [5]. 

Notes:
[1]. The painting was exhibited several times during this period; in these exhibitions, it was credited variously as having been lent by Mrs. John H. Twachtman, the Twachtman estate, and Silas S. Dustin, New York, the agent for the estate. Mrs. Twachtman is credited as the lender of the painting to a December 1910 exhibition at the Lotos Club in New York City. See curatorial file and also note [3] below. 
[2]. Evans exhibited the painting at his home, Wentworth Manor, Montclair, NJ, in February 1911. 
[3]. Sale entitled "The Private Collection of American Paintings Formed by the Widely Known Amateur William T. Evans, Esq. of New York." This painting, illustrated in the catalogue, sold on the second evening of the sale, April 1, 1913. The catalogue entry states that the painting had been purchased from Mrs. Twachtman, perhaps after the 1910 Lotos Club exhibition.
[4]. The painting was purchased from the Evans sale through William Macbeth of Macbeth Galleries. 
[5]. The painting was accessioned on April 22, 1913.
